'Lactose' is a disaccharide sugar derived from galactose and glucose that is
found most notably in cow milk. Lactose makes up around 2~8% of milk (by
weight), although the amount varies among species and individuals. It is
extracted from sweet or sour whey. The name comes from {{lang|la|lac}} or
{{lang|la|lactis}}, the Latin word for milk, plus the -ose ending used to name
sugars. It has a formula of C 12 H22 O11 .
